info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 12 at 5:52PM CDT until May 12 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN OTTAWA AND SOUTHWESTERN CLOUD COUNTIES... At 551 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles south of Barnard, moving northeast at 35 mph. Another severe storm was located near Glasco, moving northeast at 35mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Glasco, Delphos and Ada. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
